tip.para: For more general information about &ogw;, refer to .

sect1.title: Viewing &ogw;s
sect1.para: To view a list of configured &ogw;s, click Object GatewayDaemons. The list includes the ID of the gateway, host name of the cluster node where the gateway daemon is running, and the gateway's version number.
Click a gateway's table row to view detailed information about the gateway. The Performance Counters tab shows details about read/write operations and cache statistics.

sect1.title: Managing &ogw; Users
sect1.para: Click Object GatewayUsers to view a list of existing &ogw; users.
Click a user's table row to view details about the user account, such as status information or the user and bucket quota details.

sect2.title: Adding a New Gateway User
sect2.para: To add a new gateway user, click Add in the top left of the table heading. Fill in their credentials, details about the S3 key and user/bucket quota, then confirm with Add.

sect2.title: Deleting Gateway Users
sect2.para: To delete a gateway user, click the user's table row and select Delete in the top left of the table heading. Activate the Yes, I am sure check box and confirm with Delete User.

sect2.title: Editing Gateway User Details
sect2.para: To change gateway user details, click the user's table row and select Edit in the top left of the table heading.
Modify basic or additional user information, such as their capabilities, keys, sub-users, and quota information. Confirm with Update.

The Keys tab includes a read-only list of the gateway's users and their access and secret keys. To view the keys, click a user name in the list and then select Show in the top left of the table heading. In the S3 Key dialog, click the 'eye' icon to unveil the keys, or click the clipboard icon to copy the related key to the clipboard.

sect1.title: Managing the &ogw; Buckets
sect1.para: &ogw; (OGW) buckets implement the functionality of &ostack; &swift; containers. &ogw; buckets serve as containers for storing data objects.
Click Object GatewayBuckets to view a list of OGW buckets.

sect2.title: Adding a New Bucket
sect2.para: To add a new OGW bucket, click Add in the top left of the table heading. Enter the bucket's name and select its owner. Confirm with Add.

sect2.title: Viewing Bucket Details
sect2.para: To view detailed information about an OGW bucket, click its table row.

tip.title: Bucket Quota
tip.para: Below the Details table, you can find details about the bucket quota settings.

sect2.title: Updating the Owner of a Bucket
sect2.para: Click a bucket table row, then select Edit in the top left of the table heading.
Update the owner of the bucket and confirm with Update.

sect2.title: Deleting a Bucket
sect2.para: To delete an OGW bucket, click its table row and select Delete in the top left of the table heading. Activate the Yes, I am sure check box, and confirm with Delete bucket.
